Test whether your Apple Developer team signed the peer executable that communicates with your app over an XPC connection by calling
Test whether the peer executable that communicates with your app over an XPC connection satisfies a lightweight code requirement by calling

to create an XPC server that listens for messages from other processes. Use

Apple-Intelligence-updates-page-PageImag.alt: A stylistic image of the Apple Intelligence logo.

abstract.text: View major documentation updates and highlights from WWDC, browse ongoing updates from a set of framework releases over time, and jump to the latest release notes.
Learn about important changes to ARKit.
Learn about important changes to AVFAudio.
Learn about important changes to AVFoundation.
Learn about important changes to Accelerate.
Learn about important changes to Accessibility.
Learn about important changes in ActivityKit.
Learn about important changes to AdAttributionKit.
Learn about important changes in App Intents.
Learn about important changes to AppKit.
Learn about important changes to Apple Intelligence.
Learn about important changes to Apple Pencil.
Learn about important changes to Audio Toolbox.
Learn about important changes to AuthenticationServices.
Learn about important changes to Bundle Resources.
Learn about important changes to ContactsUI.
A type that performs tasks for clients across process boundaries.
A type that sends messages to a server process.
Sets a requirement that the executable for the peer process has a valid code signature that contains an entitlement.
Sets a requirement that the executable for the peer process has a valid code signature that contains an entitlement with a specific value.
Sets a requirement that the executable for the peer process has a valid code signature that matches the lightweight code requirement.
Sets a requirement that the executable for the peer process has a valid code signature that identifies it as an Apple-signed binary with the given signing identifier.
Sets a requirement that the executable for the peer process has a valid code signature and is signed by the same team identifier as the calling process.
A C type that performs tasks for clients across process boundaries.
A C type that sends messages to a server process.
A bidirectional communication channel between two processes.

featured.svg.alt: An icon, with a star and a speech bubble around it, representing updates.
